subject: Re: [junit] Doubt in Httpservletrequest and Httpservletresponse
msgSnippet: I ve had the same problem and found the easiest way is to just create your own classes that implements the HttpServletRequest and HttpServletResponse
messageBody:
I've had the same problem and found the easiest way is to just create your
own classes that implements the HttpServletRequest and HttpServletResponse
interfaces ( implementing session probably wont hurt as well ). In this way
you can test servlets and relevant classes "outside" a webserver. I've
found this approach much more feasible than to deploy the servlet and test
by making actual HttpRequests from test-classes within Junit to the
webserver. As well as it will give you a nice in depth knowledge on how the
whole servlet framework ;-)


/e




Satinder Singh
<satinderynr@yaho To: junit@yahoogroups.com
o.com> cc:
Subject: [junit] Doubt in Httpservletrequest and Httpservletresponse
28/05/2003 01:21
PM
Please respond to
junit






Hi Everybody,
As I am new to Junit I have created some small examples to test on junit
but now when I am trying to test a method of servlet having a parameters
like HttpServletRequest and HttpServletResponse here I am stuck.
Would anyone please tell me how to test a method with this type of complex
parameters.
Thanx
Satinder.
